snippet: Residents near the site of a planned tower on the East Side have formed an alliance to try to stop the project, a sign that some New Yorkers are exhausted by the relentless pace of construction.
abstract: East River 50s Alliance, group made up of residents of buildings around Sutton Place in Manhattan, is mounting campaign against 80-story deluxe skyscraper planned by developer Joseph P Beninati on nearby 58th Street; opposition, which pits affluent residents against likely super-wealthy prospective tenants of skyscraper, indicates exhaustion among New Yorkers over super-tall residential towers that are dramatically changing neighborhoods across city.
lead_paragraph: Residents near the site of a planned tower on the East Side have formed an alliance to try to stop the project, a sign that some New Yorkers are exhausted by the relentless pace of construction.

headline.main: Skyscraper That Would Soar Over Sutton Place Runs Into Neighborhood Opposition
headline.print_headline: Planned Skyscraper Encountering Opposition in Sutton Place
